result.execSummary:
The defendant Tonya N Novak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tonya N Novak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Tonya N Novak was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs/fees are assessed in 15CM346 - covers both files.  Only one assessment to be done per Court.

Jail to be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services
.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to jail sentence in 15CM346
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tonya N Novak
